newsitem.title: JAPAN: NTT to buy 35% stake in Sri Lanka telecom - report.
newsitem.headline: NTT to buy 35% stake in Sri Lanka telecom - report.

text.p: Japan telecommunications giant Nippon Telephone and Telegraph Corp (NTT) has decided to buy a 35 percent stake in state-owned Sri Lanka Telecom for $225 million as part of its plans to expand into South Asia, a Japanese financial newspaper reported on Sunday.

The daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun said the move would mark the first major involvement in a state telecoms firm by NTT, which has acquired stakes in second-tier firms in Thailand, the Philippines and other Asian countries.
NTT officials were not available for comment on the report.
Sri Lanka would keep a 65 percent stake, it said.
